CatDescriptText: Cleona M. Donan, stenographer, 304 Sylvania Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 17, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe that city patrolmen and firemen should be required to work more than 40 hours per week?" Answer reads: "No, if they are not being paid. Everybody should have standard hours and should be paid for overtime."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Cleona M. Donan wearing flecked dress with patterned belt, filigree earrings, and light colored gloves, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
